result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Cera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $243 to be paid by the defendant to the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  DNA on file.

IN CUSTODY 10:58 AM Defendant Joshua A Cera in court with attorney Luis C Cuevas. Prosecuting Atty Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty.     

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI cts 2, 3


Case 22CM759 Dismissed and read into this case. 


Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1 
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for   1 year cc to 22CM215

-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct 1
-DNA surcharge waived
-All other CC,  due  on probation



-Days credit for time already served:  9 days
-Days credit if revoked: 9 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Pre-trial conference on June 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Collin B or Devin F. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be at any bar, tavern, liquor store, or other premises whose primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 13
